title: Public opinion on the most important problem facing the U.S. 2020
summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The maximum Share of respondents 28.0 is found at Response Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership and the minimum is found at Situation in Iraq/ISIS where Share of respondents is 2.0.
The minimum Response Situation in Iraq/ISIS has got 14.0 times less Share of respondents than the maximum Response Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The maximum Share of respondents 28.0 is found at Response Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership and the minimum is found at Situation in Iraq/ISIS where Share of respondents is 2.0.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The maximum Share of respondents 28.0 is found at Response Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership and the minimum is found at Situation in Iraq/ISIS where Share of respondents is 2.0.

max_summary: This bar chart has 16 columns on the x axis representing Response, and Share of respondents in each Response on the y axis.
The Share of respondents is highest at Response Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership and lowest at Response Situation in Iraq/ISIS.
The difference of Share of respondents between the highest and lowest Response is 26.0.

Response Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership is higher than any other Responses with value 28.0, followed by , and Healthcare. Down to Response Situation in Iraq/ISIS with the lowest value 2.0.

Similar Share of respondents is found in Response Situation in Iraq/ISIS, Foreign policy/Foreign aid/Focus overseas, Economy in general, Guns/Gun control, Gap between rich and poor, Education, and Wars/War (nonspecific)/Fear of war.
The Response Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership has 5.6 times more Share of respondents than average.
Summing up the values of all Responses, we get total 80.0.

data.Response: Lack of respect for each other
